e.name: inputMediaInvoice
e.comment: Generated invoice of a bot payment

arguments.name: photo
arguments.comment: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

arguments.name: payload
arguments.comment: Bot-defined invoice payload, 1-128 bytes. This will not be displayed to the user, use for your internal processes.

arguments.name: provider_data
arguments.comment: JSON-encoded data about the invoice, which will be shared with the payment provider. A detailed description of required fields should be provided by the payment provider.

arguments.name: start_param
arguments.comment: Unique bot deep links start parameter. If present, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a URL button with a deep link to the bot (instead of a Pay button), with the value used as the start parameter. If absent, forwarded copies of the sent message will have a Pay button, allowing multiple users to pay directly from the forwarded message, using the same invoice.

arguments.name: proximity_notification_radius

e.name: inputMediaWebPage
e.comment: Specifies options that will be used to generate the link preview for the caption, or even a standalone link preview without an attached message.

arguments.name: force_large_media
arguments.comment: If set, specifies that a large media preview should be used.

arguments.name: force_small_media
arguments.comment: If set, specifies that a small media preview should be used.

arguments.name: optional
arguments.comment: If not set, a WEBPAGE_NOT_FOUND RPC error will be emitted if a webpage preview cannot be generated for the specified url; otherwise, no error will be emitted (unless the provided message is also empty, in which case a MESSAGE_EMPTY will be emitted, instead).

arguments.name: url
arguments.comment: The URL to use for the link preview.

arguments.comment: Whether viewing/writing in this channel for a reason (see restriction_reason

arguments.comment: If set, this supergroup/channel was reported by many users as a fake or scam: be careful when interacting with it.

arguments.comment: Whether this channel or group is protected, thus does not allow forwarding messages from it

arguments.name: join_to_send
arguments.comment: Whether a user needs to join the supergroup before they can send messages: can be false only for discussion groups Â», toggle using {@link channels.RawToggleJoinToSendRequest}

arguments.comment: Whether a user's join request will have to be approved by administrators, toggle using {@link channels.RawToggleJoinRequestRequest}

arguments.name: stories_hidden
arguments.comment: Whether we have hidden all stories posted by this channel Â».

arguments.comment: If set, indicates that the stories_hidden flag was not populated, and its value must cannot be relied on; use the previously cached value, or re-fetch the constructor using {@link channels.RawGetChannelsRequest} to obtain the latest value of the stories_hidden flag.

arguments.name: stories_unavailable
arguments.comment: No stories from the channel are visible.

arguments.name: view_forum_as_messages
arguments.comment:
Users may also choose to display messages from all topics of a forum as if they were sent to a normal group, using a "View as messages" setting in the local client.
This setting only affects the current account, and is synced to other logged in sessions using the {@link channels.RawToggleViewForumAsMessagesRequest} method; invoking this method will update the value of this flag.

e.name: messageMediaWebPage
e.comment: Preview of webpage

arguments.comment: If set, specifies that a small media preview should be used.

arguments.comment: If set, indicates that the URL used for the webpage preview was specified manually using {@link RawInputMediaWebPage}, and may not be related to any of the URLs specified in the message.

arguments.name: safe
arguments.comment: If set, the webpage can be opened directly without user confirmation; otherwise, user confirmation is required, showing the exact URL that will be opened.

e.name: messageMediaVenue

arguments.name: photo
arguments.comment: URL of the product photo for the invoice. Can be a photo of the goods or a marketing image for a service. People like it better when they see what they are paying for.

arguments.comment: Message ID of receipt: if set, clients should change the text of the first {@link RawKeyboardButtonBuy} button always attached to the {@link RawMessage} to a localized version of the word Receipt

arguments.name: total_amount
arguments.comment: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

arguments.name: start_param
arguments.comment: Unique bot deep-linking parameter that can be used to generate this invoice

e.name: messageMediaGiveaway
e.comment: Contains info about a giveaway, see here Â» for more info.

arguments.name: only_new_subscribers
arguments.comment: If set, only new subscribers starting from the giveaway creation date will be able to participate to the giveaway.

arguments.name: winners_are_visible
arguments.comment: If set, giveaway winners are public and will be listed in a {@link RawMessageMediaGiveawayResults} message that will be automatically sent to the channel once the giveaway ends.

arguments.name: channels
arguments.comment: The channels that the user must join to participate in the giveaway.

arguments.name: countries_iso2
arguments.comment: If set, only users residing in these countries can participate in the giveaway, (specified as a list of two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country codes); otherwise there are no country-based limitations.

arguments.name: prize_description
arguments.comment: Can contain a textual description of additional giveaway prizes.

arguments.name: quantity
arguments.comment: Number of Telegram Premium subscriptions given away.

arguments.name: months
arguments.comment: Duration in months of each Telegram Premium subscription in the giveaway.

arguments.name: until_date
arguments.comment: The end date of the giveaway.

e.name: messageMediaGiveawayResults
e.comment: A giveaway with public winners has finished, this constructor contains info about the winners.

arguments.name: only_new_subscribers
arguments.comment: If set, only new subscribers starting from the giveaway creation date participated in the giveaway.

arguments.name: refunded
arguments.comment: If set, the giveaway was canceled and was fully refunded.

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.comment: ID of the channel that was automatically boosted by the winners of the giveaway for duration of the Premium subscription.

arguments.name: additional_peers_count
arguments.comment: Number of other channels that participated in the giveaway.

arguments.name: launch_msg_id
arguments.comment: Identifier of the message with the giveaway in channel_id.

arguments.name: winners_count
arguments.comment: Total number of winners in the giveaway.

arguments.name: winners
arguments.comment: Up to 100 user identifiers of the winners of the giveaway.

arguments.name: months
arguments.comment: Duration in months of each Telegram Premium subscription in the giveaway.

arguments.name: prize_description
arguments.comment: Can contain a textual description of additional giveaway prizes.

arguments.name: until_date
arguments.comment: Point in time (UNIX timestamp in seconds) when the winners were selected. May be bigger than winners selection date specified in initial parameters of the giveaway.

e.name: messageActionBotAllowed
e.comment:
We have given the bot permission to send us direct messages.

The optional fields specify how did we authorize the bot to send us messages.

arguments.name: attach_menu
arguments.comment: We have authorized the bot to send us messages by installing the bot's attachment menu.

arguments.name: from_request
arguments.comment: We have allowed the bot to send us messages using {@link bots.RawAllowSendMessageRequest}.

arguments.name: domain
arguments.comment: We have authorized the bot to send us messages by logging into a website via Telegram Login Â»; this field contains the domain name of the website on which the user has logged in.

arguments.name: app
arguments.comment: We have authorized the bot to send us messages by opening the specified bot mini app.

e.name: messageActionSecureValuesSentMe

arguments.name: values
arguments.comment: Vector with information about documents and other Telegram Passport elements that were shared with the bot

arguments.comment: New Time-To-Live of all messages sent in this chat; if 0, autodeletion was disabled.

arguments.name: auto_setting_from
arguments.comment: If set, the chat TTL setting was set not due to a manual change by one of participants, but automatically because one of the participants has the {@link messages.RawSetDefaultHistoryTTLRequest}. For example, when a user writes to us for the first time and we have set a default messages TTL of 1 week, this service message (with auto_setting_from=our_userid) will be emitted before our first message.

arguments.comment: If no custom emoji icon is specified, specifies the color of the fallback topic icon (RGB), one of 0x6FB9F0, 0xFFD67E, 0xCB86DB, 0x8EEE98, 0xFF93B2, or 0xFB6F5F.

e.name: messageActionSetChatWallPaper
e.comment: The wallpaper Â» of the current chat was changed.

arguments.name: same
arguments.comment: If set, indicates the user applied a wallpaper Â» previously sent by the other user in a {@link RawMessageActionSetChatWallPaper} message.

arguments.name: for_both
arguments.comment:
If set, indicates the wallpaper was forcefully applied for both sides, without explicit confirmation from the other side.
If the message is incoming, and we did not like the new wallpaper the other user has chosen for us, we can re-set our previous wallpaper just on our side, by invoking {@link messages.RawSetChatWallPaperRequest}, providing only the revert flag (and obviously the peer parameter).

e.name: messageActionGiftCode

arguments.comment: If set, the link was not redeemed yet.

arguments.comment: Identifier of the channel that created the gift code either directly or through a giveaway: if we import this giftcode link, we will also automatically boost this channel.

arguments.comment: Duration in months of the gifted Telegram Premium subscription.

arguments.name: slug
arguments.comment: Slug of the Telegram Premium giftcode link

arguments.name: amount
arguments.comment: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

arguments.name: crypto_currency
arguments.comment: If set, the gift was made using the specified cryptocurrency.

This setting only affects the current account, and is synced to other logged in sessions using the {@link channels.RawToggleViewForumAsMessagesRequest} method; invoking this method will update the value of this flag.

In case the popup parameter was passed, the text message must be displayed in a popup alert immediately upon receipt. Once a story is successfully uploaded, an {@link RawUpdateStoryID} will be returned, indicating the story ID (id) that was attributed to the story (like for messages, random_id indicates the random_id that was passed to {@link stories.RawSendStoryRequest}: this way, you can tell which story was assigned a specific id by checking which {@link stories.RawSendStoryRequest} call has the returned random_id).

e.comment:
Users may also choose to display messages from all topics as if they were sent to a normal group, using a "View as messages" setting in the local client.
This setting only affects the current account, and is synced to other logged in sessions using the {@link channels.RawToggleViewForumAsMessagesRequest} method; invoking this method will update the value of the view_forum_as_messages flag of {@link RawChannelFull} or {@link RawDialog} and emit an {@link RawUpdateChannelViewForumAsMessages}.

arguments.comment: Maximum allowed incoming ring time in VoIP calls: if the current user doesn't reply within the specified time (in milliseconds), the call will be automatically refused

arguments.name: call_connect_timeout_ms
arguments.comment: VoIP connection timeout: if the instance of libtgvoip on the other side of the call doesn't connect to our instance of libtgvoip within the specified time (in milliseconds), the call must be aborted

arguments.comment: If during a VoIP call a packet isn't received for the specified period of time, the call must be aborted

e.name: keyboardButtonUrlAuth
e.comment: Button to request a user to authorize via URL using Seamless Telegram Login. When the user clicks on such a button, {@link messages.RawRequestUrlAuthRequest} should be called, providing the button_id and the ID of the container message. The returned {@link RawUrlAuthResultRequest} object will contain more details about the authorization request (request_write_access if the bot would like to send messages to the user along with the username of the bot which will be used for user authorization). Finally, the user can choose to call {@link messages.RawAcceptUrlAuthRequest} to get a {@link RawUrlAuthResultAccepted} with the URL to open instead of the url of this constructor, or a {@link RawUrlAuthResultDefault}, in which case the url of this constructor must be opened, instead. If the user refuses the authorization request but still wants to open the link, the url of this constructor must be used.

arguments.name: fwd_text
arguments.comment: New text of the button in forwarded messages.

arguments.name: url
arguments.comment:
An HTTP URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.

NOTE: Services must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

arguments.name: button_id
arguments.comment: ID of the button to pass to {@link messages.RawRequestUrlAuthRequest}

e.name: inputKeyboardButtonUrlAuth
e.comment: Button to request a user to {@link messages.RawAcceptUrlAuthRequest} via URL using Seamless Telegram Login.

arguments.name: request_write_access
arguments.comment: Set this flag to request the permission for your bot to send messages to the user.

arguments.name: fwd_text
arguments.comment: New text of the button in forwarded messages.

arguments.name: url
arguments.comment:
An HTTP URL to be opened with user authorization data added to the query string when the button is pressed. If the user refuses to provide authorization data, the original URL without information about the user will be opened. The data added is the same as described in Receiving authorization data.
NOTE: You must always check the hash of the received data to verify the authentication and the integrity of the data as described in Checking authorization.

arguments.name: bot
arguments.comment: Username of a bot, which will be used for user authorization. See Setting up a bot for more details. If not specified, the current bot's username will be assumed. The url's domain must be the same as the domain linked with the bot. See Linking your domain to the bot for more details.

e.name: replyKeyboardHide
e.comment: Hide sent bot keyboard

arguments.name: selective
arguments.comment:
Use this flag if you want to remove the keyboard for specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

Example: A user votes in a poll, bot returns confirmation message in reply to the vote and removes the keyboard for that user, while still showing the keyboard with poll options to users who haven't voted yet

e.name: replyKeyboardForceReply
e.comment: Force the user to send a reply

arguments.name: single_use
arguments.comment: Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat â€“ the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again.

arguments.name: selective
arguments.comment:
Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.
Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

arguments.name: placeholder
arguments.comment: The placeholder to be shown in the input field when the keyboard is active; 1-64 characters.

e.name: replyKeyboardMarkup
e.comment: Bot keyboard

arguments.name: resize
arguments.comment: Requests clients to resize the keyboard vertically for optimal fit (e.g., make the keyboard smaller if there are just two rows of buttons). If not set, the custom keyboard is always of the same height as the app's standard keyboard.

arguments.name: single_use
arguments.comment: Requests clients to hide the keyboard as soon as it's been used. The keyboard will still be available, but clients will automatically display the usual letter-keyboard in the chat â€“ the user can press a special button in the input field to see the custom keyboard again.

arguments.name: selective
arguments.comment:
Use this parameter if you want to show the keyboard to specific users only. Targets: 1) users that are @mentioned in the text of the Message object; 2) if the bot's message is a reply (has reply_to_message_id), sender of the original message.

Example: A user requests to change the bot's language, bot replies to the request with a keyboard to select the new language. Other users in the group don't see the keyboard.

arguments.name: saved_from_id
arguments.comment: Only for forwarded messages reforwarded to saved messages Â», contains the sender of the original message (i.e. if user A sends a message, then user B forwards it somewhere, then user C saves it to saved messages, this field will contain the ID of user A and from_id will contain the ID of user B).

arguments.name: saved_from_name
arguments.comment: Only for forwarded messages from users with forward privacy enabled reforwarded to saved messages Â», contains the sender of the original message (i.e. if user A (fwd privacy enabled) sends a message, then user B forwards it somewhere, then user C saves it to saved messages, this field will contain the name of user A and from_id will contain the ID of user B).

arguments.name: saved_date
arguments.comment: Only for forwarded messages reforwarded to saved messages Â», indicates when was the original message sent (i.e. if user A sends a message @ unixtime 1, then user B forwards it somewhere @ unixtime 2, then user C saves it to saved messages @ unixtime 3, this field will contain 1, date will contain 2 and the date of the containing {@link RawMessage} will contain 3).

e.name: auth.codeTypeSms

e.name: auth.sentCodeTypeCall
e.comment: The code will be sent via a phone call: a synthesized voice will tell the user which verification code to input.

e.name: auth.sentCodeTypeFlashCall
e.comment: The code will be sent via a flash phone call, that will be closed immediately. The phone code will then be the phone number itself, just make sure that the phone number matches the specified pattern.

e.name: auth.sentCodeTypeMissedCall
e.comment: The code will be sent via a flash phone call, that will be closed immediately. The last digits of the phone number that calls are the code that must be entered manually by the user.

arguments.name: prefix

arguments.name: reset_available_period
arguments.comment: Clients should wait for the specified amount of seconds before allowing the user to invoke {@link auth.RawResetLoginEmailRequest} (will be 0 for Premium users).

arguments.name: reset_pending_date
arguments.comment: An email reset was already requested, and will occur at the specified date.

e.name: auth.sentCodeTypeSetUpEmailRequired
e.comment: The user should add and verify an email address in order to login as described here Â».

arguments.name: apple_signin_allowed

arguments.name: receipt
arguments.comment: On iOS, must be compared with the receipt extracted from the received push notification.

arguments.name: length
arguments.comment: Length of the code that will be delivered.

e.name: premiumSubscriptionOption
e.comment: Describes a Telegram Premium subscription option

arguments.name: current
arguments.comment: Whether this subscription option is currently in use.

arguments.name: can_purchase_upgrade
arguments.comment: Whether this subscription option can be used to upgrade the existing Telegram Premium subscription. When upgrading Telegram Premium subscriptions bought through stores, make sure that the store transaction ID is equal to transaction, to avoid upgrading someone else's account, if the client is currently logged into multiple accounts.

arguments.name: transaction
arguments.comment: Identifier of the last in-store transaction for the currently used subscription on the current account.

arguments.name: amount
arguments.comment: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

arguments.name: store_product
arguments.comment: Store product ID, only for official apps

e.comment: Indicates a peer that can be used to send messages

arguments.name: premium_required
arguments.comment: Whether a Telegram Premium account is required to send messages as this peer

e.name: forumTopic
e.comment: Represents a forum topic.

arguments.name: my
arguments.comment: Whether the topic was created by the current user

arguments.name: closed
arguments.comment: Whether the topic is closed (no messages can be sent to it)

arguments.name: short
arguments.comment:
Whether this constructor is a reduced version of the full topic information.
If set, only the my, closed, id, date, title, icon_color, icon_emoji_id and from_id parameters will contain valid information.
Reduced info is usually only returned in topic-related admin log events Â» and in the {@link messages.RawChannelMessages} constructor: if needed, full information can be fetched using {@link channels.RawGetForumTopicsByIDRequest}.

arguments.name: hidden
arguments.comment: Whether the topic is hidden (only valid for the "General" topic, id=1)

arguments.name: icon_color
arguments.comment: If no custom emoji icon is specified, specifies the color of the fallback topic icon (RGB), one of 0x6FB9F0, 0xFFD67E, 0xCB86DB, 0x8EEE98, 0xFF93B2, or 0xFB6F5F.

arguments.name: icon_emoji_id
arguments.comment: ID of the custom emoji used as topic icon.

arguments.name: top_message
arguments.comment: ID of the last message that was sent to this topic

arguments.name: read_inbox_max_id
arguments.comment: Position up to which all incoming messages are read.

arguments.name: read_outbox_max_id
arguments.comment: Position up to which all outgoing messages are read.

arguments.name: unread_reactions_count
arguments.comment: Number of unread reactions to messages you sent

arguments.name: from_id
arguments.comment: ID of the peer that created the topic

arguments.name: order_by_create_date
arguments.comment: Whether the returned topics are ordered by creation date; if set, pagination by offset_date should use {@link RawForumTopic}.date; otherwise topics are ordered by the last message date, so paginate by the date of the message referenced by {@link RawForumTopic}.top_message.

arguments.name: count
arguments.comment: Total number of topics matching query; may be more than the topics contained in topics, in which case pagination is required.

arguments.name: messages
arguments.comment: Related messages (contains the messages mentioned by {@link RawForumTopic}.top_message).

e.name: inputReplyToMessage
e.comment: Reply to a message.

arguments.name: reply_to_msg_id
arguments.comment: The message ID to reply to.

arguments.name: top_msg_id
arguments.comment:
This field must contain the topic ID only when replying to messages in forum topics different from the "General" topic (i.e. reply_to_msg_id is set and reply_to_msg_id != topicID and topicID != 1).
If the replied-to message is deleted before the method finishes execution, the value in this field will be used to send the message to the correct topic, instead of the "General" topic.

arguments.name: reply_to_peer_id
arguments.comment: Used to reply to messages sent to another chat (specified here), can only be used for non-protected chats and messages.

arguments.name: quote_text
arguments.comment: Used to quote-reply to only a certain section (specified here) of the original message. The maximum UTF-8 length for quotes is specified in the quote_length_max config key.

arguments.name: quote_entities
arguments.comment: Message entities for styled text from the quote_text field.

arguments.name: quote_offset
arguments.comment: Offset of the message quote_text within the original message (in UTF-16 code units).

arguments.name: months
arguments.comment: Duration in months of each gifted Telegram Premium subscription.

arguments.name: store_product
arguments.comment: Identifier of the store product associated with the option, official apps only.

arguments.comment: Number of times the store product must be paid

arguments.comment: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).

e.name: payments.checkedGiftCode
e.comment: Contains info about a Telegram Premium giftcode link.

arguments.name: via_giveaway
arguments.comment: Whether this giftcode was created by a giveaway.

arguments.name: from_id
arguments.comment: The peer that created the gift code.

arguments.name: giveaway_msg_id
arguments.comment: Message ID of the giveaway in the channel specified in from_id.

arguments.name: to_id
arguments.comment: The destination user of the gift.

arguments.name: date
arguments.comment: Creation date of the gift code.

arguments.name: months
arguments.comment: Duration in months of the gifted Telegram Premium subscription.

arguments.name: used_date
arguments.comment: When was the giftcode imported, if it was imported.

e.name: payments.giveawayInfo
e.comment: Contains info about an ongoing giveaway. If neither the participating, joined_too_early_date, admin_disallowed_chat_id or disallowed_country flags are set, the user is not currently participating in the giveaway but could participate by joining all the channels specified in the {@link RawMessageMediaGiveaway}.channels field.

arguments.name: participating
arguments.comment: The current user is participating in the giveaway.

arguments.name: preparing_results
arguments.comment: If set, the giveaway has ended and the results are being prepared.

arguments.name: joined_too_early_date
arguments.comment: The current user can't participate in the giveaway, because they were already a member of the channel when the giveaway started, and the only_new_subscribers was set when starting the giveaway.

arguments.name: admin_disallowed_chat_id
arguments.comment: If set, the current user can't participate in the giveaway, because they are an administrator in one of the channels (ID specified in this flag) that created the giveaway.

arguments.name: disallowed_country
arguments.comment: If set, the current user can't participate in this giveaway, because their phone number is from the specified disallowed country (specified as a two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code).

e.name: payments.giveawayInfoResults
e.comment: A giveaway has ended.

arguments.name: winner
arguments.comment: Whether we're one of the winners of this giveaway.

arguments.name: refunded
arguments.comment: Whether the giveaway was canceled and was fully refunded.

arguments.name: gift_code_slug
arguments.comment: If we're one of the winners of this giveaway, contains the Premium gift code, see here Â» for more info on the full giveaway flow.

arguments.name: finish_date
arguments.comment: End date of the giveaway. May be bigger than the end date specified in parameters of the giveaway.

arguments.name: winners_count
arguments.comment: Number of winners in the giveaway

arguments.name: activated_count
arguments.comment: Number of winners, which activated their gift codes.

e.name: prepaidGiveaway
e.comment: Contains info about a prepaid giveaway Â».

arguments.name: months
arguments.comment: Duration in months of each gifted Telegram Premium subscription.

arguments.name: quantity
arguments.comment: Number of given away Telegram Premium subscriptions.

e.name: boost
e.comment: Info about one or more boosts applied by a specific user.

arguments.name: gift
arguments.comment: Whether this boost was applied because the channel directly gifted a subscription to the user.

arguments.name: giveaway
arguments.comment: Whether this boost was applied because the user was chosen in a giveaway started by the channel.

arguments.name: unclaimed
arguments.comment: If set, the user hasn't yet invoked {@link payments.RawApplyGiftCodeRequest} to claim a subscription gifted directly or in a giveaway by the channel.

arguments.name: id
arguments.comment: Unique ID for this set of boosts.

arguments.name: user_id
arguments.comment: ID of the user that applied the boost.

arguments.name: used_gift_slug
arguments.comment: The created Telegram Premium gift code, only set if either gift or giveaway are set AND it is either a gift code for the currently logged in user or if it was already claimed.

arguments.name: multiplier
arguments.comment: If set, this boost counts as multiplier boosts, otherwise it counts as a single boost.

e.name: premium.boostsList
e.comment: List of boosts that were applied to a peer by multiple users.

arguments.name: next_offset
arguments.comment: Offset that can be used for pagination.

e.name: myBoost
e.comment: Contains information about a single boost slot Â».

arguments.name: peer
arguments.comment:
If set, indicates this slot is currently occupied, i.e. we are boosting this peer.
Note that we can assign multiple boost slots to the same peer.

arguments.name: date
arguments.comment: When (unixtime) we started boosting the peer, 0 otherwise.

arguments.name: expires
arguments.comment: Indicates the (unixtime) expiration date of the boost in peer (0 if peer is not set).

arguments.name: cooldown_until_date
arguments.comment: If peer is set, indicates the (unixtime) date after which this boost can be reassigned to another channel.

e.name: premium.myBoosts
e.comment: A list of peers we are currently boosting, and how many boost slots we have left.

arguments.name: my_boosts
arguments.comment: Info about boosted peers and remaining boost slots.

e.name: premium.boostsStatus
e.comment: Contains info about the current boost status of a peer.

arguments.name: my_boost
arguments.comment: Whether we're currently boosting this channel, my_boost_slots will also be set.

arguments.name: level
arguments.comment: The current boost level of the channel.

arguments.name: current_level_boosts
arguments.comment: The number of boosts acquired so far in the current level.

arguments.name: boosts
arguments.comment: Total number of boosts acquired so far.

arguments.name: gift_boosts
arguments.comment: The number of boosts acquired from created Telegram Premium gift codes and giveaways; only returned to channel admins.

arguments.name: next_level_boosts
arguments.comment: Total number of boosts needed to reach the next level; if absent, the next level isn't available.

arguments.name: premium_audience
arguments.comment: Only returned to channel admins: contains the approximated number of Premium users subscribed to the channel, related to the total number of subscribers.

arguments.name: boost_url
arguments.comment: Boost deep link Â» that can be used to boost the chat.

arguments.name: prepaid_giveaways
arguments.comment: A list of prepaid giveaways available for the chat; only returned to channel admins.

arguments.name: my_boost_slots

e.name: users.setSecureValueErrors
e.comment: Notify the user that the sent passport data contains some errors The user will not be able to re-submit their Passport data to you until the errors are fixed (the contents of the field for which you returned the error must change). Use this if the data submitted by the user doesn't satisfy the standards your service requires for any reason. For example, if a birthday date seems invalid, a submitted document is blurry, a scan shows evidence of tampering, etc. Supply some details in the error message to make sure the user knows how to correct the issues.

arguments.name: background
arguments.comment:
While the geolocation of the current user is public, clients should update it in the background every half-an-hour or so, while setting this flag.
Do this only if the new location is more than 1 KM away from the previous one, or if the previous location is unknown.

e.name: messages.createChat
e.comment: Creates a new chat. May also return 0-N updates of type {@link RawUpdateGroupInvitePrivacyForbidden}: it indicates we couldn't add a user to a chat because of their privacy settings; if required, an invite link can be shared with the user, instead.

arguments.name: users
arguments.comment: List of user IDs to be invited

arguments.name: ttl_period
arguments.comment: Time-to-live of all messages that will be sent in the chat: once message.date+message.ttl_period === time(), the message will be deleted on the server, and must be deleted locally as well. You can use {@link messages.RawSetDefaultHistoryTTLRequest} to edit this value later.

e.name: messages.setInlineBotResults
e.comment: Answer an inline query, for bots only

arguments.name: gallery
arguments.comment: Set this flag if the results are composed of media files

arguments.name: private
arguments.comment: Set this flag if results may be cached on the server side only for the user that sent the query. By default, results may be returned to any user who sends the same query

arguments.name: query_id
arguments.comment: Unique identifier for the answered query

arguments.name: results
arguments.comment: Vector of results for the inline query

arguments.name: cache_time
arguments.comment: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the result of the inline query may be cached on the server. Defaults to 300.

arguments.name: next_offset
arguments.comment: Pass the offset that a client should send in the next query with the same text to receive more results. Pass an empty string if there are no more results or if you don't support pagination. Offset length can't exceed 64 bytes.

arguments.name: switch_pm
arguments.comment: If passed, clients will display a button on top of the remaining inline result list with the specified text, that switches the user to a private chat with the bot and sends the bot a start message with a certain parameter.

arguments.name: switch_webview
arguments.comment: If passed, clients will display a button on top of the remaining inline result list with the specified text, that switches the user to the specified inline mode mini app.

e.name: messages.setBotPrecheckoutResults
e.comment:
Once the user has confirmed their payment and shipping details, the bot receives an {@link RawUpdateBotPrecheckoutQuery} update.
Use this method to respond to such pre-checkout queries.
Note: Telegram must receive an answer within 10 seconds after the pre-checkout query was sent.

arguments.name: success
arguments.comment: Set this flag if everything is alright (goods are available, etc.) and the bot is ready to proceed with the order, otherwise do not set it, and set the error field, instead

arguments.name: query_id
arguments.comment: Unique identifier for the query to be answered

arguments.name: error
arguments.comment: Required if the success isn't set. Error message in human readable form that explains the reason for failure to proceed with the checkout (e.g. "Sorry, somebody just bought the last of our amazing black T-shirts while you were busy filling out your payment details. Please choose a different color or garment!"). Telegram will display this message to the user.

throws.name: ERROR_TEXT_EMPTY
throws.comment: The provided error message is empty.

arguments.comment: If set, will send a {@link RawMessageActionSuggestProfilePhoto} service message to user_id, suggesting them to use the specified profile picture; otherwise, will set a personal profile picture for the user (only visible to the current user).

arguments.name: save
arguments.comment: If set, removes a previously set personal profile picture (does not affect suggested profile pictures, to remove them simply deleted the {@link RawMessageActionSuggestProfilePhoto} service message with {@link messages.RawDeleteMessagesRequest}).

arguments.name: video_start_ts
arguments.comment: Floating point UNIX timestamp in seconds, indicating the frame of the video/sticker that should be used as static preview; can only be used if video or video_emoji_markup is set.

arguments.name: video_emoji_markup
arguments.comment: Animated sticker profile picture, must contain either a {@link RawVideoSizeEmojiMarkup} or a {@link RawVideoSizeStickerMarkup} constructor.

e.name: help.getRecentMeUrls
e.comment:
Get recently used t.me links. When installing official applications from "Download Telegram" buttons present in t.me pages, a referral parameter is passed to applications after installation.
If, after downloading the application, the user creates a new account (instead of logging into an existing one), the referral parameter should be imported using this method, which returns the t.me pages the user recently opened, before installing Telegram.

e.name: channels.reorderPinnedForumTopics
e.comment: Reorder pinned forum topics

arguments.name: force
arguments.comment:
If not set, the order of only the topics present both server-side and in order will be changed (i.e. mentioning topics not pinned server-side in order will not pin them, and not mentioning topics pinned server-side will not unpin them).
If set, the entire server-side pinned topic list will be replaced with order (i.e. mentioning topics not pinned server-side in order will pin them, and not mentioning topics pinned server-side will unpin them)

e.name: stories.sendStory
e.comment: Uploads a Telegram Story.

arguments.name: pinned
arguments.comment: Whether to add the story to the profile automatically upon expiration. If not set, the story will only be added to the archive, see here Â» for more info.

arguments.name: noforwards
arguments.comment: If set, disables forwards, screenshots, and downloads.

arguments.comment: Set this flag when reposting stories with fwd_from_id+fwd_from_id, if the media was modified before reposting.

arguments.comment: The peer to send the story as.

arguments.name: media_areas
arguments.comment: Media areas associated to the story, see here Â» for more info.

arguments.name: entities
arguments.comment: Message entities for styled text, if allowed by the stories_entities client configuration parameter Â».

arguments.name: privacy_rules
arguments.comment: Privacy rules for the story, indicating who can or can't view the story.

arguments.name: random_id
arguments.comment: Unique client message ID required to prevent message resending.

arguments.name: period
arguments.comment: Period after which the story is moved to archive (and to the profile if pinned is set), in seconds; must be one of 6 * 3600, 12 * 3600, 86400, or 2 * 86400 for Telegram Premium users, and 86400 otherwise.

arguments.name: fwd_from_id
arguments.comment: If set, indicates that this story is a repost of story with ID fwd_from_story posted by the peer in fwd_from_id.

arguments.name: fwd_from_story

u.Error: An object containing a query error.
u.InputFileLocation: Defines the location of a file for download.
u.InputUser: Defines a user for subsequent interaction.
u.InputContact: Object defines a contact from the user's phone book.
u.InputFile: Defines a file uploaded by the client.
u.InputMedia: Defines media content of a message.
u.InputChatPhoto: Defines a new group profile photo.
u.InputPhoto: Defines a photo for further interaction.
u.UserProfilePhoto: Object contains info on the user's profile photo.
u.ChatFull: Full info about a channel, supergroup, gigagroup or basic group.
u.ChatParticipants: Object contains info on group members.
u.ChatPhoto: Object defines a group profile photo.
u.MessageAction: Object describing actions connected to a service message.
u.PhotoSize: Location of a certain size of a picture
u.auth.SentCode: Contains info on a confirmation code message sent via SMS, phone call or Telegram.
u.auth.Authorization: Object contains info on user authorization.
u.InputNotifyPeer: Object defines the set of users and/or groups that generate notifications.
u.PeerSettings: List of actions that are possible when interacting with this user, to be shown as suggested actions in the chat bar
u.Contact: A contact of the current user.
u.ImportedContact: Object contains info on a successfully imported contact.
u.contacts.Contacts: Info on the current user's contact list.
u.contacts.ImportedContacts: Object contains info on successfully imported contacts.
u.contacts.Blocked: Info on users from the current user's black list.
u.messages.Dialogs: Object contains a list of chats with messages and auxiliary data.
u.messages.Messages: Object contains information on list of messages with auxiliary data.
u.messages.Chats: Object contains list of chats with auxiliary data.
u.messages.ChatFull: Full info about a channel, supergroup, gigagroup or basic group.
u.messages.AffectedHistory: Object contains info on affected part of communication history with the user or in a chat.
u.Update: Object contains info on events occurred.
u.updates.State: Object contains info on state for further updates.
u.Updates: Object which is perceived by the client without a call on its part when an event occurs.
u.photos.Photos: Object contains list of photos with auxiliary data.
u.DcOption: Information for connection to data center.
u.Config: Object contains info on API configuring parameters.
u.NearestDc: Object contains info on nearest data center.
u.help.AppUpdate: Contains info on app update availability.
u.help.InviteText: Object contains info on the text of a message with an invitation.
u.EncryptedChat: Object contains info on an encrypted chat.
u.InputEncryptedChat: Object sets an encrypted chat ID.
u.InputEncryptedFile: Object sets encrypted file for attachment
u.messages.DhConfig: Contains Diffie-Hellman key generation protocol parameters.
u.messages.SentEncryptedMessage: Contains info on message sent to an encrypted chat.
u.InputDocument: Defines a document for subsequent interaction.
u.help.Support: Info about the support user, relevant to the current user.
u.NotifyPeer: Object defines the set of users and/or groups that generate notifications.
u.SendMessageAction: User actions. Use this to provide users with detailed info about their chat partner's actions: typing or sending attachments of all kinds.
u.contacts.Found: Object contains info on users found by name substring and auxiliary data.
u.InputPrivacyKey: Privacy keys together with privacy rules Â» indicate what can or can't someone do and are specified by a PrivacyKey constructor, and its input counterpart InputPrivacyKey. See the privacy documentation Â» for more info.
u.PrivacyKey: Privacy keys together with privacy rules Â» indicate what can or can't someone do and are specified by a PrivacyKey constructor, and its input counterpart InputPrivacyKey. See the privacy documentation Â» for more info.
u.InputPrivacyRule: Privacy rules indicate who can or can't do something and are specified by a PrivacyRule, and its input counterpart InputPrivacyRule. See the privacy documentation Â» for more info.
u.PrivacyRule: Privacy rules together with privacy keys indicate what can or can't someone do and are specified by a PrivacyRule constructor, and its input counterpart InputPrivacyRule. See the privacy documentation Â» for more info.
u.DocumentAttribute: Various possible attributes of a document (used to define if it's a sticker, a GIF, a video, a mask sticker, an image, an audio, and so on)
u.account.PasswordSettings: Private info associated to the password info (recovery email, telegram passport info & so on)
u.account.PasswordInputSettings: Constructor for setting up a new 2FA SRP password
u.auth.PasswordRecovery: Recovery info of a 2FA password, only for accounts with a recovery email configured.
u.BotCommand: Describes a bot command that can be used in a chat
u.BotInfo: Info about bots (available bot commands, etc)
u.ReplyMarkup: Reply markup for bot and inline keyboards
u.MessageEntity: Message entities, representing styled text in a message
u.MessageRange: Indicates a range of chat messages
u.updates.ChannelDifference: Contains the difference (new messages) between our local channel state and the remote state
u.ChannelMessagesFilter: Filter for fetching only certain types of channel messages
u.help.TermsOfService: Contains info about the latest telegram Terms Of Service.
u.InputBotInlineMessage: Represents a sent inline message from the perspective of a bot
u.messages.BotResults: Result of a query to an inline bot
u.ExportedMessageLink: HTTP link and embed info of channel message
u.auth.CodeType: Type of verification code that will be sent next if you call the resendCode method
